result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Syris Thomas Birkley

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Arguments made by State and Defendant.  Court reinstates bail.  Jury Trial remains calendared on November 14, 2022 at 9:00 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Letter from defendant re:  copies of transcripts.  (Syris T. Birkley - #22011350, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Mr. Birkley appears pro se.  Defendant requests a bail/bond hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Jury Trial remains calendared on November 14, 2022 at 9:00 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court, appears pro se.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin.

Defendant appears in person.  Court vacates bench warrant issued.  Court addresses Justice Point discharge with defendant.  Statements made.  Court ordered defendant remanded into custody.  Court scheduled final pre-trial.  Jury Trial remains calendared on November 14, 2022 at 9:00 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley not in court.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin.

Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Defendant does not appear and has been discharged from Justice Point.  Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.  If defendant does not appear within 30 days (deadline of 10-19-2022), jury trial scheduled on 11-14-2022 will be vacated.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Bail/bond hearing on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court sets bail hearing regarding justice point violation. Case set on 9-19-2022 8:30 am in person. Parties notified.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court. (PRO SE) Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Joinder motion heard as to cases 2022CF2796 and 2022CF503. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record Court denies joinder motion. Defendant places record of status. Court sets both of defendant's cases for jury trial. Case adjourned in Branch 2.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court, appear in person. Defendant appear PO SE.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to case 22CF503. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer H. Almas.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

22RM034949  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFF
027/21/2022
Defendant to have no contact with KNT or Walmart on South 27th Street.

Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision. 
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears in court pro se. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel. 
State raisess competency. Court finds defendant competent to proceed. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Arguments heard as to bail. 
Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Syris Thomas Birkley in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears pro se.  Defendant refuses to be interviewed by State Public Defender's Office.
Case is adjourned to the Judge for and adjourned Initial appearance and a hearing on whether the defendant can appear pro se.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
